definition.name: Permutations_h1_h2_h3
definition.definition:
The permutations h₁, h₂, h₃ ∈ Sym(Ω) are defined in cycle notation as follows:

h₁ := (1 4) — the transposition swapping 1 and 4, fixing all other elements
h₂ := (2 5) — the transposition swapping 2 and 5, fixing all other elements  
h₃ := (3 6) — the transposition swapping 3 and 6, fixing all other elements

Explicitly: h₁(1)=4, h₁(4)=1, h₁(2)=2, h₁(3)=3, h₁(5)=5, h₁(6)=6
           h₂(2)=5, h₂(5)=2, h₂(1)=1, h₂(3)=3, h₂(4)=4, h₂(6)=6
           h₃(3)=6, h₃(6)=3, h₃(1)=1, h₃(2)=2, h₃(4)=4, h₃(5)=5

Each hᵢ is an involution (hᵢ² = id) of order 2. The three transpositions are pairwise disjoint, hence they commute: hᵢhⱼ = hⱼhᵢ for all i,j.
